Key Match Events: India played out a goalless draw against hosts Afghanistan at the Damac Stadium in Abha, Saudi Arabia.
Vikram Partap Singh made the starting XI for the first time in his career and was a constant thorn in the Afghanistan defence.
Manvir Singh had multiple opportunities to score but missed.
Vikram Pratap Singh missed several chances to score in the second half.
Rahul Bheke made a crucial intervention to prevent Omid Popalzay from scoring.
Subhasish Bose missed a free header inside the Afghanistan box.
Liston Colaco created a last-minute opportunity that was ultimately unsuccessful.
Pre-Game Insights: The equation was clear for both teams: a win would significantly improve their standings in Group A.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India climbed to the second spot in Group A with four points from three matches.
Afghanistan and India will face off again on March 26 in Guwahati for their second encounter in the Asian Qualifiers for the FIFA World Cup.
